data.title: Collapsing a block doesn't collapse content with lower indenting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.17.0 (be377c0faf7574a59f84940f593a6849f12e4de7, 2017-10-04T23:45:46.804Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
Bookmarks|ale|0.16.0
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
python|don|0.7.0
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
latex-workshop|Jam|3.5.5
expand-region|let|0.1.1
HTMLHint|mka|0.4.0
cpptools|ms-|0.13.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.1
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3
code-spell-checker|str|1.4.6
python|tht|0.2.3
vscode-todo-highlight|way|0.5.11
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.10.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a block of code where a line has no indenting (or just lower than the block itself)
2. Try to collapse it
3. Observe it collapsing everything but that line

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

![example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5385012/31254669-f9798482-aa29-11e7-8cd8-da87f3f21f32.gif)

This behavior makes sense when dealing with lines that simply have less indenting, as there's no difference in how the code would function and the author can just increase the indenting if necessary. But when the lines contain for example (javascript) template strings where indenting is very important, increasing indenting is not possible (or you'll have to change the code to string[] joining).
This can be quite a pain when dealing with large sections of template strings that aren't collapsed (such as in the image below).

A possible solution except for of course collapsing everything inside a collapsed block, would be to make it possible to collapse a multi-line template string by itself.

![large example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5385012/31254886-c4ac41b2-aa2a-11e7-948b-8f84807dc54c.gif)

data.title: extensions connect ENOENT error MacOS since 1.14
data.body:
Selecting the Extensions icon in the left tool bar results in the following error message:

`connect ENOENT /var/folders/my/t5b899fn0_s4tx5_tndwnvh00000gp/C/Code-1.16.1-shared.sock`

Of course, no extensions are then listed.

This error occurs with 1.16.1, 1.15.1 and 1.14.2, but **not** with 1.13. The message is the same, except for the different version # in the .sock file.

The `.sock` file does not exist, hence the `ENOENT` error. There are many other files in that directory.

Since it looks like a networking error, I should note my Mac has 2 VPN services installed. 
* Tunnel Bear
* F5 SSL VPN Plugin (a VPN service for my university, which I need)

Neither are loaded when the error occurs.

- VSCode Version: 1.14+
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.6


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: See above

data.title: Allow snippets to start with other characters than alphabetical
data.body: Currently when I write a snippet it only works when it starts with [a-zA-Z] characters, in my other IDE I have tons of snippets that start like /*=, *=, */,  and so on, this is not possible with VS Code unfortunately. Allowing this will really improve my experience as I'm really used to my sets of snippets.

data.title: Create an option to position the intellisense parameter info top or bottom.
data.body:
This is the same issue as #33752. I do not understand why that issue was closed. It had recent comments in the conversation and no additional information was requested:

Currently the parameter info tooltip is always placed above the cursor. This is often quite annoying since it completely blocks code in the above lines and you sometimes need to look at your context to know what values to give the parameters.

Example:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/702922/30005026-e9034dec-9096-11e7-80c0-1a23814ca15c.png)

Note: Once you select a method, the intellisense tooltip is hidden. There is no reason to place the parameter tooltip at the top.

data.title: Exiting code doesn't ask to terminate running task
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.17.0 (be377c0faf7574a59f84940f593a6849f12e4de7, 2017-10-04T23:45:46.804Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.7
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
githistory|don|0.2.3
gitlens|eam|5.4.1
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1
Angular2|joh|2.7.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create script to run server in package.json
  "scripts": {
    "server": "tsc --watch | nodemon --inspect --watch dist"
  },
2. Create task (using the 2.0.0. compatibility version) and run "server" command which will run corresponding script with node and tsc processes.  
{
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "type": "process",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "type": "npm",
            "script": "server",
            "problemMatcher": [],
            "isBackground": true,
            "promptOnClose": true,
            "presentation": {
                "echo": true,
                "reveal": "always",
                "focus": false,
                "panel": "new"
            }
        }

3. Take "File/Exit" , the code editor close without asking to terminate running task, all node instances remain running and must be killed from the task manager.  

Workaround :
==========
If you create task with the 0.1.0 standard compatibility, everything works as expected. The command is successfully ran and on the exit, editor ask I you wish to terminate running task. If you choose Yes, all node instances and tsc in the "watch" state are successfully terminated. 
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "isShellCommand": false,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "run server",
            "showOutput": "always",
            "command": "npm",
            "args": [
                "run", 
                "server"
            ]
        },

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes
Reproduces in 32bit and 64bit version on windows 10

data.title: Tasks print "Terminal will be reused" even when presentation.panel set to "new"

milestone.title: On Deck

The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:26:20.018Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.13.4-200.fc26.x86_64

---

This is just a little nitpick. When running a task with

```json
	"presentation": {
		"panel": "new"
	}
```

the terminal prints

```
Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it.
```

But that terminal will never be reused as I've disabled that in my tasks.json.

data.title: Providing different icon for the TouchBar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
TouchBar is completely different way of providing command from the UX point of view - it's not clearly connected to the given part of editor (what suggest context, and usage for normal commands icons, and there is no easy way to get tooltip describing what icon mean.  Also, the format of the field on TouchBar is different than usual.

I think it would be good idea to provide separate icon for the TouchBar instead of always reusing the icon that's defined for other parts of the UI, as the icon in TouchBar has different requirements from the ones put next to TreeView title, or anywhere else

data.title: [cpp] Put class open brace on new line as you type

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.17.0 (be377c0faf7574a59f84940f593a6849f12e4de7, 2017-10-05T06:07:51.906Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
csharpfixformat|Leo|0.0.36
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.10.0
terminal|for|0.0.10
path-autocomplete|ion|1.6.1
csharpextensions|jch|1.3.0
vscode-nuget-package-manager|jmr|1.1.4
mssql|ms-|1.2.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
team|ms-|1.122.0
vscode-format|rya|0.0.6



---

I've already spend hours finding how to put open brace to the new line when you type. 

I type this:
`class Foo{`

...and press Enter. I get the closing brace automatically:
```
class Foo{

}
```
But I want this (like VS 2017 did):
```
class Foo
{

}
```

I can do that with format command (Shift + Alt + F), but can I have it automatically?

I've tried different extensions (my lines from in User Settings).

ryannaddy.vscode-format: "format.newLine": { "brace": true }
Leopotam.csharpfixformat: "csharpfixformat.style.braces.onSameLine": false
"editor.formatOnType": true
Omnisharp: { "FormattingOptions": { "NewLinesForBracesIn...": true, } }
All without any success, none of these setting did this formatting on typing.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

I personally have no need for recent files to be promoted to the top of the Goto File results: 

![6xjw-kiw](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1199742/31247619-03a204a2-a9c6-11e7-98f2-2bf8385ad616.png)

These results actually slow me down, since I a used to Sublime Text fuzzy match behavior. If the "Recently Opened" results were not there, I would be able to jump to files in a predictable way.

Any preference option I'm missing?

data.title: Support auto-closing quotes in Python raw string literals, etc
data.body:
Python uses a ["string prefix"](https://docs.python.org/3/reference/lexical_analysis.html#string-and-bytes-literals) to denote bytes literals (`b''`), raw strings (`r''`), and formatted string literals (`f''`).  This change makes it so that when one types `r'` in VS Code, the string will be auto-closed as `r''` (as an example).

Python also supports multiple string prefixes for a single literal.  I've tested that typing `fr'` will auto-close to `fr''`, and so forth.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder with a ASP.NET project in it
2. Perform a find and replace entering "Block.FeatureCard" to the find and "Block.Cards" for the replace
3. Click the replace all button
4. Look in the cs files and see it worked fine, but look in the cshtml files and notice that a line like "@using NewProj.Blocks.FeatureCard.Simple" is replaced with "@using NewProj.BBlocks.CardsSimple". Notice the B is duplicated and the '.' before "Simple" is missing.

Note: This does not seem to happen if you manually replace them one by one in the find pane. Only seems to happen when clicking replace all.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: File Explorer hijacks keyboard focus somehow

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This has been an issue for me for months now on the insider edition as well as the stable version. I can't narrow down when or why it happens. (I decided to make an issue and see if others have noticed this or can narrow down how to reproduce it. If that's against guidelines this can be removed)

I'll be focused on an actual file and typing in new code will work, but the enter key, arrow keys, and delete will do actions within the file explorer instead of my code. I try hitting escape, spam clicking in the open file to try forcing a focus state change but that doesn't work. The only fix I could find is to open other files then go back to what I was working on.

data.title: Slow go to declaration fo typescript when tsconfig has "paths"
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16
- OS Version: macOs high sierra 10.13

Steps to Reproduce:

add path to tsconfig.json

```json
"paths": {
      "@angular/*": [
        "../node_modules/@angular/*"
      ],
      "@app/shared/*": [
        "app/shared/*"
      ],
      "@app/core/*": [
        "app/core/*"
      ]
    }
```

Go to declaration very slow. It can take 5-10 second.

Without "paths" in tsconfig go to declaration works incredible fast.

typescript: 2.5.2

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Provide TextMate scope for static functions in PHP language grammar
VS Code Auto Fetch Improvements
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20294  SSH connections with VS Code put my IP address on a blacklist (too many failed logins) 
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8469 Autofetch should be disable by default

It is destructive when the git repo is an ssh link, and vscode doesn't prompt for credentials, so it just causes blacklisting from too many invalid ssh logins.
I was working remotely on a system, and suddenly in the middle of editing things the connection dies.  (it is a remote asking for a fetch from my server, which blacklisted the remote I was working on).

It(vscode) should at least check to see the repository origin url is ssh or not.
Yes, setting (git.autofetch configuration flag set to false) this now stops the issue which happened 3 times, fortunately 2 of the times I wasn't in the middle of typing.
